title: AAQ: Is it wrong to seek one's glorification? | HG Madhu Pandit Dasa
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.text: Another point, important point that Prabhupada is mentioning, here is that, it is a natural
instinct for the Lord to hear and enjoy His personal glories.
And because of this, each of us are an individual part and parcel of Krishna.
We also have a tendency to feel what?
Happy when somebody glorifies us.
But this is asat, in the material world, that pervertedly reflected.
In the spiritual world, the devotee also likes to be known in the eyes of the Lord, that
He is happy with my service.
And therefore when the Guru says, yes, you have done service.
Good service.
Then he is, he also likes to hear that.
Very good, you have distributed hundred Bhagavatam sets.
Very good, Prabhupada says.
You should enjoy that.
Don't feel shy, it's your nature.
Don't enjoy wrong praise.
Don't seek wrong praise.
Don't seek wrong praise.
Don't seek wrong glorification.
Don't take credit for what you do not deserve.
You deserve credit for choosing to serve Krishna than Maya.
For your choice, you require, that is rewarded, you should feel proud about it and you should
expand that pride.
Pride, that I will never serve Maya, I will only serve Krishna.
So Krishna's, we are amsa of Krishna.
So it's the same tendency is there in us.
We are amsa of Krishna, Krishna is sacchidananda, we are amsa, but our present.
There is nothing wrong in chasing after happiness, ananda.
But we are wrongly chasing.
Because without Purna, without Krishna connection, there is no question of getting any strength.
If I cut my fingers from the body, it will lose all its strength.
Our current situation is like that.
Even the cut fingers, still hungry for oxygen, blood, everything, doesn't stop.
Of course, it's a very crude example.
If it is one jiva, one finger is one jiva, cut off from the main, the Lord, that main
connection with the Lord is function of devotional service.
Gets cut off, then that soul will still, because nature is that, where is ananda, where is
jiva?
I don't want to die.
So all the tendencies, we being part and parcel of Krishna, Krishna's nature is there
in us, but it has to be properly redirected.
Prabhupada says misdirected love of Godhead is called lust.
Just see, lust is defined as misdirected love of Godhead.
Your nature is to love God.
But you have forgotten Krishna, so it has turned into lust in this material world.
